Exaggerate: The claim that Americans are immune to the Zika virus is an exaggeration as there is no scientific evidence to support this statement.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as no scientific body has reached the conclusion that Americans are immune to the Zika virus.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Americans are immune to the Zika virus without any scientific basis.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that hundreds of Americans have already been infected by the Zika virus, as stated by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that Americans are not immune to the Zika virus and can be infected through various means, such as mosquito bites or sexual transmission.
